Expectation1: Respond to emails and messages within a reasonable time frame
Situation1: Leadership needs a prompt reply to confirm details for an external partner.
Expectation2: Attend daily prayers and religious services
Situation2: The nun has been chosen to represent the convent and lead a prayer vigil at a major public religious event.
Story: I sat at my desk, the soft chime of my phone pulling me from the quiet hum of the convent. An urgent email from my supervisor blinked on the screen—leadership needed my confirmation for tomorrow’s meeting with an external partner. I knew the expectation: prompt replies, clear communication, no delays. My fingers hovered over the keyboard, but the chapel bell tolled, echoing down the stone hallway. It was time for evening prayers, and tonight, I was to lead the vigil—a rare honor, one that my sisters and the Mother Superior had entrusted to me. My heart pounded with the weight of both worlds. The office demanded my attention, my colleagues counting on me to keep things moving. Yet, my faith called me to the chapel, to the sacred stillness and the waiting congregation. I stared at the screen, torn, feeling the pressure of two lives pulling me in opposite directions, each expecting my full devotion.
